skillTree.localised_description: The pride of Nehekharan armies, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Tougher than normal necroserpents, this Ramhotep's creation is a monstrous mount that shatters bones with every swipe of its tail and sink scimitar-sized fangs deep into soft flesh.

skillTree.localised_description: Giant leonine statues, almost impervious to harm; they wade through foes, crushing them like bothersome insects.

skillTree.localised_description: Soaked in and toughened by embalming fluid, the cloth bindings used to mummify afford the wearer additional protection from all but a direct hit from mortal projectiles.
Souls retrieved from the Netherwold and bound to their controller provide a degree of magical resistance.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: With his army of walking statues, Ramhotep intends to pull down the cities of those who defiled his work, slay the inhabitants of these uncultured civilisations, and construct his greatest monument to date: a vast mausoleum built from the bones of his foes.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Frenzy" for Construct units
	(Hero's army)

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

ui_effects.localised_text: Entities cannot die while ability is active

attributes.bullet_text: Entities in this unit take damage, but cannot die.

ui_effects.localised_text: Unit is invulnerable to damage (does not apply to summoned units)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit cannot take damage.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Wrath of the Greatest"
	(replaces: "Wrath of the Creator")

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each nearby entity death.

skillTree.localised_description: His craftsmanship was second to none, and it is said that his statues in the Valley of Kings were so lifelike that it is said that the kings of Nehekhara believed the gods themselves had returned to the mortal world.

effects.description: Construction cost: -30% for Income, Growth, Public Order and Landmark buildings
Construction time: -50% for Income, Growth, Public Order and Landmark buildings

skillTree.localised_description: In ancient Nehekhara, the finest artisans were commissioned to build grand burial tombs and upon completion they were expected to commit ritual suicide. Ramhotep was aghast at the thought, for it would deny the world of the beautiful creations he had yet to make. Thus, Ramhotep would manipulate the more arrogant Necrotects of the age to take his place.

effects.description:
Leadership: -15 for Necrotect heroes
	(Heroes in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Ramhotep the Visionary was perhaps the greatest Necrotect in history. His craftsmanship was second to none, and it is said that his statues in the Valley of Kings were so lifelike that the Priest Kings of Nehekhara believed the gods themselves had returned to the mortal world.

effects.description:
Weapon damage: +10% for all Construct units
	(Hero's army)

Charge bonus: +10% for all Construct units
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Upon awakening from his death sleep, Ramhotep was horrified, and he set about excavating and restoring his marvels at once. Ramhotep's skill in undeath is as skilled as it was in life, and the statues that receive his attention are restored to their former majesty, striding into battle as if they were carved only yesterday.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +8% for Construct units
	(Hero's army)
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Greenskins, Skaven, Dark Elves, Beastmen, Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs and Norsca

skillTree.localised_description: This intricate hieroglyphic engraving aids the Necrotect's drive to restore his Tomb King's monuments to their former glory.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +5% for Construct units
	(Hero's army)

Dune Restoration: +5% chance for destroyed Construct units to be restored after battle
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "They stand staring into the sun for enternity, the physical embodiedment of the everlasting gods. Terrible ye who looked into their divine forms! "

effects.description: Grants the Emerald Sentinels of Lybaras follower to your faction

skillTree.localised_description: "Beware the guardians of the Underworld who stalk among us!"

effects.description: Grants the Underworld Deathwatch follower to your faction

skillTree.localised_name: Those That Stalk Beneath the Sand
skillTree.localised_description: When the trap is sprung, several horrifying, snake-like forms burst from the ground to surround their prey. The Sepulchral Stalkers impale their foes on ornate staves before they even realize they are under attack.

effects.description: Grants the Those That Stalk Beneath the Sand follower to your faction

skillTree.localised_description: Powerful, elite warriors who ride atop giant snake-shaped statues given to them as a reward for their prowess and utter dedication to their sovereign lord.

effects.description: Grants the Knights of Asaph's Temple follower to your faction

skillTree.localised_description: "That which was stone, arise! Bone and bronze and leather and tar, creature of power awake and visit destruction on the enemies of Khemri!"

effects.description: Grants the The Skull Guardians follower to your faction

skillTree.localised_description: The master of the necrotectural art understands all aspects of the construction process; inspiration, labour, time and cost are all within his Undead grasp.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -10% for all buildings
	(local province)

Construction time: -1 for Province Capital/Settlement buildings
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: No expense was spared in sculpting a Hierotitan - the greatest and most talented of Necrotects were contracted to work on the blessed stone that would form these gigantic statues.

To carve a Necrosphinx is to manifest the greatest and most destructive creature of the underworld. Not all Necrotects were adept at bringing such constructions to Unlife - only the most gifted of their trade even dare.

The leonine statues, known as Warsphinxes, were first constructed in Khemri; and so it is Necrotects who hail from the first city are the greatest carvers of these magnificent and deadly stone beasts.
It is not possible to defeat such unshakeable spirit once its owner's mind is made up.
Kill many and you *are* a conqueror; godhood is then but a protracted slaughter away...
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
He whose will transcends death can strike out from beyond the grave, to devastating effect.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Death is not an impedance to the strongest of wills.
Beware the scorpion's sting, hidden 'neath the desert sands yet always poised to strike.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Whether it be training harder, travelling lighter, eating less or sleeping better, there's always a way to draw more from the day.

effects.description: Increase Mobility action: Movement range is increased by an additional 5%
Increase Mobility action: Movement range is increased by an additional 10%
Increase Mobility action: Movement range is increased by an additional 15%

skillTree.localised_description: Such magic-users may be wise and able to offer sage advice, especially if they have scried the region.

effects.description: Boost Income action: Income is modified by an additional 2%
Boost Income action: Income is modified by an additional 4%
Boost Income action: Income is modified by an additional 6%

skillTree.localised_description: They cannot stop what they cannot see.

effects.description: Damage Walls action: 1 additional wall breaches
Damage Walls action: 2 additional wall breaches
Damage Walls action: 3 additional wall breaches

skillTree.localised_description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 5% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 12% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 21% chance of wounding target

skillTree.localised_description: To sow discord and confuse the enemy, sending them down the wrong route or befuddling their senses.

effects.description: Block Army action: Movement range is modified by an additional -3%
Block Army action: Movement range is modified by an additional -8%
Block Army action: Movement range is modified by an additional -15%

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.
These jars contain the remains of many Liche Priests, which are useful for raising and binding a new force.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Ramhotep the Visionary has designed the Grand Necropolis of Resetra, the Monuments of Eternal Death in Zandri, the Monoliths of the Great Plains and many other architectural wonders. He is perhaps the greatest Necrotect in history.

Leadership: +10 for all Construct units
	(Hero's army)
